trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect sync: Scheduler | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect sync: Scheduler | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the built-in scheduler feature in Azure AD Connect sync.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the built-in scheduler feature in Azure AD Connect sync.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect sync: Scheduler
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect sync: Scheduler

trans-unit.source: This topic describes the built-in scheduler in Azure AD Connect sync (a.k.a.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes the built-in scheduler in Azure AD Connect sync (a.k.a.

trans-unit.source: sync engine).
trans-unit.target: sync engine).

trans-unit.source: This feature was introduced with build 1.1.105.0 (released February 2016).
trans-unit.target: This feature was introduced with build 1.1.105.0 (released February 2016).

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect sync will synchronize changes happening in your on-premises directory using a scheduler.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect sync will synchronize changes happening in your on-premises directory using a scheduler.

trans-unit.source: There are two scheduler processes, one for password sync and another for object/attribute sync, and maintenance tasks.
trans-unit.target: There are two scheduler processes, one for password sync and another for object/attribute sync, and maintenance tasks.

trans-unit.source: This topic will cover the latter.
trans-unit.target: This topic will cover the latter.

trans-unit.source: In earlier releases the scheduler for objects and attributes was external to the sync engine and the Windows task scheduler or a separate Windows service was used to trigger the synchronization process.
trans-unit.target: In earlier releases the scheduler for objects and attributes was external to the sync engine and the Windows task scheduler or a separate Windows service was used to trigger the synchronization process.

trans-unit.source: The scheduler is with the 1.1 releases built-in to the sync engine and do allow some customization.
trans-unit.target: The scheduler is with the 1.1 releases built-in to the sync engine and do allow some customization.

trans-unit.source: The new default synchronization frequency is 30 minutes.
trans-unit.target: The new default synchronization frequency is 30 minutes.

trans-unit.source: The scheduler is responsible for two tasks:
trans-unit.target: The scheduler is responsible for two tasks:

trans-unit.source: **Synchronization cycle**.
trans-unit.target: **Synchronization cycle**.

trans-unit.source: The process to import, sync, and export changes.
trans-unit.target: The process to import, sync, and export changes.

trans-unit.source: **Maintenance tasks**.
trans-unit.target: **Maintenance tasks**.

trans-unit.source: Renew keys and certificates for Password reset and Device Registration Service (DRS).
trans-unit.target: Renew keys and certificates for Password reset and Device Registration Service (DRS).

trans-unit.source: Purge old entries in the operations log.
trans-unit.target: Purge old entries in the operations log.

trans-unit.source: The scheduler itself is always running, but it can be configured to only run one or none of these tasks.
trans-unit.target: The scheduler itself is always running, but it can be configured to only run one or none of these tasks.

trans-unit.source: For example if you need to have your own synchronization cycle process, you can disable this task in the scheduler but still run the maintenance task.
trans-unit.target: For example if you need to have your own synchronization cycle process, you can disable this task in the scheduler but still run the maintenance task.

trans-unit.source: Scheduler configuration
trans-unit.target: Scheduler configuration

trans-unit.source: To see your current configuration settings, go to PowerShell and run `Get-ADSyncScheduler`.
trans-unit.target: To see your current configuration settings, go to PowerShell and run `Get-ADSyncScheduler`.

trans-unit.source: It will show you something like this:
trans-unit.target: It will show you something like this:

trans-unit.source: GetSyncScheduler
trans-unit.target: GetSyncScheduler

trans-unit.source: **AllowedSyncCycleInterval**.
trans-unit.target: **AllowedSyncCycleInterval**.

trans-unit.source: The most frequently Azure AD will allow synchronizations to occur.
trans-unit.target: The most frequently Azure AD will allow synchronizations to occur.

trans-unit.source: You cannot synchronize more frequently than this and still be supported.
trans-unit.target: You cannot synchronize more frequently than this and still be supported.

trans-unit.source: **CurrentlyEffectiveSyncCycleInterval**.
trans-unit.target: **CurrentlyEffectiveSyncCycleInterval**.

trans-unit.source: The schedule currently in effect.
trans-unit.target: The schedule currently in effect.

trans-unit.source: It will have the same value as CustomizedSyncInterval (if set) if it is not more frequent than AllowedSyncInterval.
trans-unit.target: It will have the same value as CustomizedSyncInterval (if set) if it is not more frequent than AllowedSyncInterval.

trans-unit.source: If you change CustomizedSyncCycleInterval, this will take effect after next synchronization cycle.
trans-unit.target: If you change CustomizedSyncCycleInterval, this will take effect after next synchronization cycle.

trans-unit.source: **CustomizedSyncCycleInterval**.
trans-unit.target: **CustomizedSyncCycleInterval**.

trans-unit.source: If you want the scheduler to run at any other frequency than the default 30 minutes, you will configure this setting.
trans-unit.target: If you want the scheduler to run at any other frequency than the default 30 minutes, you will configure this setting.

trans-unit.source: In the picture above the scheduler has been set to run every hour instead.
trans-unit.target: In the picture above the scheduler has been set to run every hour instead.

trans-unit.source: If you set this to a value lower than AllowedSyncInterval, the latter will be used.
trans-unit.target: If you set this to a value lower than AllowedSyncInterval, the latter will be used.

trans-unit.source: **NextSyncCyclePolicyType**.
trans-unit.target: **NextSyncCyclePolicyType**.

trans-unit.source: Either Delta or Initial.
trans-unit.target: Either Delta or Initial.

trans-unit.source: Defines if the next run should only process delta changes, or if the next run should do a full import and sync, which would also reprocess any new or changed rules.
trans-unit.target: Defines if the next run should only process delta changes, or if the next run should do a full import and sync, which would also reprocess any new or changed rules.

trans-unit.source: **NextSyncCycleStartTimeInUTC**.
trans-unit.target: **NextSyncCycleStartTimeInUTC**.

trans-unit.source: Next time the scheduler will start the next sync cycle.
trans-unit.target: Next time the scheduler will start the next sync cycle.

trans-unit.source: **PurgeRunHistoryInterval**.
trans-unit.target: **PurgeRunHistoryInterval**.

trans-unit.source: The time operation logs should be kept.
trans-unit.target: The time operation logs should be kept.

trans-unit.source: These can be reviewed in the synchronization service manager.
trans-unit.target: These can be reviewed in the synchronization service manager.

trans-unit.source: The default is to keep these for 7 days.
trans-unit.target: The default is to keep these for 7 days.

trans-unit.source: **SyncCycleEnabled**.
trans-unit.target: **SyncCycleEnabled**.

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the scheduler is running the import, sync, and export processes as part of its operation.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if the scheduler is running the import, sync, and export processes as part of its operation.

trans-unit.source: **MaintenanceEnabled**.
trans-unit.target: **MaintenanceEnabled**.

trans-unit.source: Shows if the maintenance process is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Shows if the maintenance process is enabled.

trans-unit.source: It will update the certificates/keys and purge the operations log.
trans-unit.target: It will update the certificates/keys and purge the operations log.

trans-unit.source: **IsStagingModeEnabled**.
trans-unit.target: **IsStagingModeEnabled**.

trans-unit.source: Shows if [staging mode](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#staging-mode) is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Shows if [staging mode](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#staging-mode) is enabled.

trans-unit.source: You can modify all these settings with `Set-ADSyncScheduler`.
trans-unit.target: You can modify all these settings with `Set-ADSyncScheduler`.

trans-unit.source: The parameter IsStagingModeEnabled can only be set by the installation wizard.
trans-unit.target: The parameter IsStagingModeEnabled can only be set by the installation wizard.

trans-unit.source: The scheduler configuration is stored in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The scheduler configuration is stored in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: If you have a staging server, any change on the primary server will also effect the staging server (with the exception of IsStagingModeEnabled).
trans-unit.target: If you have a staging server, any change on the primary server will also effect the staging server (with the exception of IsStagingModeEnabled).

trans-unit.source: Start the scheduler
trans-unit.target: Start the scheduler

trans-unit.source: The scheduler will by default run every 30 minutes.
trans-unit.target: The scheduler will by default run every 30 minutes.

trans-unit.source: In some cases you might want to run a sync cycle in between the scheduled cycles or you need to run a different type.
trans-unit.target: In some cases you might want to run a sync cycle in between the scheduled cycles or you need to run a different type.

trans-unit.source: Delta sync cycle
trans-unit.target: Delta sync cycle

trans-unit.source: A delta sync cycle includes the following steps:
trans-unit.target: A delta sync cycle includes the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Delta import on all Connectors
trans-unit.target: Delta import on all Connectors

trans-unit.source: Delta sync on all Connectors
trans-unit.target: Delta sync on all Connectors

trans-unit.source: Export on all Connectors
trans-unit.target: Export on all Connectors

trans-unit.source: It could be that you have an urgent change which must be synchronized immediately which is why you need to manually run a cycle.
trans-unit.target: It could be that you have an urgent change which must be synchronized immediately which is why you need to manually run a cycle.

trans-unit.source: If you need to manually run a cycle, then from PowerShell run `Start-ADSyncSyncCycle -PolicyType Delta`.
trans-unit.target: If you need to manually run a cycle, then from PowerShell run `Start-ADSyncSyncCycle -PolicyType Delta`.

trans-unit.source: Full sync cycle
trans-unit.target: Full sync cycle

trans-unit.source: If you have made one of the following configuration changes, you need to run a full sync cycle (a.k.a.
trans-unit.target: If you have made one of the following configuration changes, you need to run a full sync cycle (a.k.a.

trans-unit.source: Initial):
trans-unit.target: Initial):

trans-unit.source: Added more objects or attributes to be imported from a source directory
trans-unit.target: Added more objects or attributes to be imported from a source directory

trans-unit.source: Made changes to the Synchronization rules
trans-unit.target: Made changes to the Synchronization rules

trans-unit.source: Changed [filtering](active-directory-aadconnectsync-configure-filtering.md) so a different number of objects should be included
trans-unit.target: Changed [filtering](active-directory-aadconnectsync-configure-filtering.md) so a different number of objects should be included

trans-unit.source: If you have made one of these changes, then you need to run a full sync cycle so the sync engine has the opportunity to reconsolidate the connector spaces.
trans-unit.target: If you have made one of these changes, then you need to run a full sync cycle so the sync engine has the opportunity to reconsolidate the connector spaces.

trans-unit.source: A full sync cycle includes the following steps:
trans-unit.target: A full sync cycle includes the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Full Import on all Connectors
trans-unit.target: Full Import on all Connectors

trans-unit.source: Full Sync on all Connectors
trans-unit.target: Full Sync on all Connectors

trans-unit.source: Export on all Connectors
trans-unit.target: Export on all Connectors

trans-unit.source: To initiate a full sync cycle, run `Start-ADSyncSyncCycle -PolicyType Initial` from a PowerShell prompt.
trans-unit.target: To initiate a full sync cycle, run `Start-ADSyncSyncCycle -PolicyType Initial` from a PowerShell prompt.

trans-unit.source: This will start a full sync cycle.
trans-unit.target: This will start a full sync cycle.

trans-unit.source: Stop the scheduler
trans-unit.target: Stop the scheduler

trans-unit.source: If the scheduler is currently running a synchronization cycle you might need to stop it.
trans-unit.target: If the scheduler is currently running a synchronization cycle you might need to stop it.

trans-unit.source: For example if you start the installation wizard and you get this error:
trans-unit.target: For example if you start the installation wizard and you get this error:

trans-unit.source: SyncCycleRunningError
trans-unit.target: SyncCycleRunningError

trans-unit.source: When a sync cycle is running, you cannot make configuration changes.
trans-unit.target: When a sync cycle is running, you cannot make configuration changes.

trans-unit.source: You could wait until the scheduler has finished the process, but you can also stop it so you can make your changes immediately.
trans-unit.target: You could wait until the scheduler has finished the process, but you can also stop it so you can make your changes immediately.

trans-unit.source: Stopping the current cycle is not harmful and any changes still not processed will be processed with next run.
trans-unit.target: Stopping the current cycle is not harmful and any changes still not processed will be processed with next run.

trans-unit.source: Start by telling the scheduler to stop its current cycle with the PowerShell cmdlet `Stop-ADSyncSyncCycle`.
trans-unit.target: Start by telling the scheduler to stop its current cycle with the PowerShell cmdlet `Stop-ADSyncSyncCycle`.

trans-unit.source: Stopping the scheduler will not stop the current Connector from its current task.
trans-unit.target: Stopping the scheduler will not stop the current Connector from its current task.

trans-unit.source: To force the Connector to stop, take the following actions:
trans-unit.target: To force the Connector to stop, take the following actions:

trans-unit.source: StopAConnector
trans-unit.target: StopAConnector

trans-unit.source: Start **Sychronization Service** from the start menu.
trans-unit.target: Start **Sychronization Service** from the start menu.

trans-unit.source: Go to **Connectors**, highlight the Connector with the state **Running** and select **Stop** from the Actions.
trans-unit.target: Go to **Connectors**, highlight the Connector with the state **Running** and select **Stop** from the Actions.

trans-unit.source: The scheduler is still active and will start again on next opportunity.
trans-unit.target: The scheduler is still active and will start again on next opportunity.

trans-unit.source: Scheduler and installation wizard
trans-unit.target: Scheduler and installation wizard

trans-unit.source: If you start the installation wizard, then the scheduler will be temporarily suspended.
trans-unit.target: If you start the installation wizard, then the scheduler will be temporarily suspended.

trans-unit.source: This is because it is assumed you will make configuration changes and these cannot be applied if the sync engine is actively running.
trans-unit.target: This is because it is assumed you will make configuration changes and these cannot be applied if the sync engine is actively running.

trans-unit.source: For this reason, do not leave the installation wizard open since it will stop the sync engine from performing any synchronization actions.
trans-unit.target: For this reason, do not leave the installation wizard open since it will stop the sync engine from performing any synchronization actions.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Learn more about the [Azure AD Connect sync](active-directory-aadconnectsync-whatis.md) configuration.
trans-unit.target: Learn more about the [Azure AD Connect sync](active-directory-aadconnectsync-whatis.md) configuration.

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
